project.teaser: The ambition of the TRANSFORMER project is to design long-term systemic transformation frameworks for regions across Europe in order to accelerate the shift towards climate neutrality. At the onset of the project, a conceptual framework will be developed by mapping, defining...
project.objective: The ambition of the TRANSFORMER project is to design long-term systemic transformation frameworks for regions across Europe in order to accelerate the shift towards climate neutrality. At the onset of the project, a conceptual framework will be developed by mapping, defining, and categorising Transition Super-Labs (TSLs). Actual TSLs will be piloted in four regions: the Ruhr area, DE, Emilia Romagna, IT, Lower Silesia, PL and Western Macedonia, GR. The project will develop a roadmap blueprint, a toolkit (incl. matchmaking mechanisms) and a knowledge hub, on the one hand to support the pilot regions but also to be applied by other regions across Europe. Moreover, an evaluation framework will be developed in order to evaluate the impact of TSLs in the TRANSFORMER pilot regions, as well as the respective tools and structures applied by the pilot regions. Project activities will be accompanied by comprehensive communicate and disseminate activities, providing (intermediate) results of the project and the activities in the pilot TSLs, providing a Hub with information, and offering training and capacity building activities for various target groups and stakeholders. Finally, an Exploitation Plan will be prepared for a long-lasting impact of the project.
project.title: Designing long-term systemic transformation frameworks for regions – Accelerating the shift towards climate neutrality
project.keywords: Transition Super-Labs, transformation, regions, governance, climate change, climate neutrality

result.title: D2.4 Academic working paper(s) for conceptual framing of Tran-sition Super-Labs
result.description: RUB will write (at least) two academic working papers to develop and strengthen the conceptual framing of Transition Super Labs in academic discourse.

result.title: D5.2 Framework for Super-Labs Assessment – version 2
result.description: This Deliverable will consist of a second and final version of the documentation protruding to the assessment framework that will define the methodologies, techniques and success parameters for assessing operation of TSLs and achievement of expected impacts they will have to the community. The development of the assessment framework focuses especially on the following points: (1) planning for possible difficulties in the regions’ transition processes; (2) defining a set of KPIs; analysing assessment methodologies for the TSL’s criterion assessments; (3) implementing methodologies; (4) reviewing and integrating results from the implementation phase and drawing useful conclusions on efficient operation of TSLs in the preselected regions of transition.

result.title: D3.1 Recommendations for Transition Super-Lab coalitions building, empowering of vulnerable and marginalised groups, and vision process (BMR)
result.description: This Deliverable will include clear recommendations regarding the building of coalitions the empowering of vulnerable and marginalised groups and communities and the vision finding process for the TRANSFORMER Labs

result.title: D6.5 TRANSFORMER Exploitation Plan
result.description: This Deliverable will (1) assess the exploitation potential of the Super-Lab solutions, (2) identify strategic, operational, financial and legal bottlenecks that could influence market exploitation, (3) provide results, learnings and recommendations for overcoming them, and (4) propose strategies for scaling up and uptake. The dissemination of these results and key findings will be through all communication channels outlined: website, online media, partners and stakeholders, and a series of online conversation-led podcasts, each dedicated to one sub-part of the Exploitation Plan.

result.title: D2.1 Summary of data collection on TSL predecessors
result.description: This Deliverable will include a database of projects and structures that may be seen as precursors of SuperLabs in the EU and beyond to feed into the TRANSFORMER project as guiding knowledge and real world experience

result.title: D4.4 Knowledge Hub
result.description: This Deliverable will consist of a Knowledge Hub. The Knowledge Hub will include a collection of knowledge items from both external sources (other projects/initiatives/open innovation community) and the involved Super-Labs (validated within the pilot process) that will be structured along the phases and elements of the TSL blueprint/roadmap process to guide users through the hub. The items will be composed of material on how to integrate TSL of different domains into a unique initiative, how to coordinate their efforts/experiments and how to drive their results into actionable outputs supporting policy decisions to achieve climate neutrality. It will operate as a wise-advisory tool supporting cities/regions in evolving their domain-based innovation infrastructures into multi-domain TSLs.

result.title: D5.4 Guidelines for Super-Labs tools utilisation
result.description: Based on a substantial evaluation of the usability, validity and adaptability of the tools, this Deliverable will provide guidelines for Super-Labs supporting tools utilisation. This evaluation will be based on the answers to the questions about how efficient the selected tools are for achieving the region transition in terms of governance and decision-making processes as well as about the tool’s ability to be adjusted to different future conditions ensuring the resilience and scalability of the solutions.

result.title: D4.1 Super-Lab Roadmap - version 1
result.description: This Deliverable will consist of a first version blueprint for a SuperLab Roadmap based on the intermediary results and learnings of the first 12 month of the TRANSFORMER project Lessons learned from the participating TSLs WP3 and beyond via a User Forum WP6 will be integrated into its development

result.title: D3.2 Definition of Transition Super-Lab use cases
result.description: This Deliverable will document the monitoring of TSLs partners on cocreation and codesign pilot use cases for their labs which will be implemented ensuring the application of the integrative open innovation process for the use case solutions demonstration

result.title: D3.4 Transition Super-Labs' Lessons Learned
result.description: This Deliverable will document an internal process evaluation and experience exchange format (key stakeholder interviews & workshops) deriving lessons learned along the development phases of the TSL (see also task 4.1 for phases) analysing the context, barriers and framework conditions that influenced the set-up of the TSL and their cross-sectoral open innovation approach.

result.title: D6.3 TRANSFORMER Hub
result.description: The TRANSFORMER Hub will serve as the central communication channel for the project The online Hub will be developed to be accessible and approachable for all target groups and stakeholders easily searchable with automated translation with a combination of semiprivate under user login and public features eg About News space Publications Trainings combining the Virtual space and Connected Repository Stakeholder space and feed from the Knowledge Platform and its Tool Inventory WP4

result.title: D2.3 Regional SWOT analyses as feasibility studies to be used as evidence-base in decision-making for roadmap construc-tion
result.description: This Deliverable will develop an appropriate mix of methods (e.g. focus groups, expert interviews, document analysis) to generate data about the Super-Labs and apply this methodology in tandem with the task partners. Following a harmonised approach that allows for interregional comparisons, this data will be integrated in the form of regional SWOT analyses and made available to the stakeholders in the four TRANSFORMER Super-Labs. Important aspects will be: risks and benefits of different solutions, financial feasibility, key transformation challenges, innovative potential, available strategies, potential networks, social implications (assessment of needs and preferences of those groups most affected and vulnerable, questions of social resistance), and aspects of diversity (including gender).

result.title: D5.1 Framework for Super-Labs Assessment - version 1
result.description: This Deliverable will consist of a first draft version of the documentation protruding to the assessment framework that will define the methodologies techniques and success parameters for assessing operation of TSLs and achievement of expected impacts they will have to the community The development of the assessment framework focuses especially on the following points 1 planning for possible difficulties in the regions transition processes 2 defining a set of KPIs analysing assessment methodologies for the TSLs criterion assessments 3 implementing methodologies 4 reviewing and integrating results from the implementation phase and drawing useful conclusions on efficient operation of TSLs in the preselected regions of transition

result.title: D5.3 Best practices and recommendations for Super-Labs opera-tion towards the region transition
result.description: This Deliverable will document best practices and recommendations for the Super-Labs operation working towards the regions transition to climate neutrality. The recommendations will be based on the impact evaluation undertaken as part of Task 5.2, focusing on the achievement of the specific needs of the regions that will be examined using KPIs and techniques of the assessment framework. Special attention will be paid to (1) the improvement of the operational readiness of the pilot actions and (2) the level of fulfilment of the regional needs and priorities through pilot outcomes. Best practice cases will be presented as examples for future TSLs.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - TRANSFORMER (Designing long-term systemic transformation frameworks for regions – Accelerating the shift towards climate neutrality)
result.description: periodic
result.teaser: Climate change is a paramount challenge of our time, necessitating an urgent and fundamental transformation of the EU's economy to meet the ambitious goals of the Paris Agreement and the European Green Deal. The challenge lies in achieving a carbon-neutral economy within a...

Visual representation of the TRANSFORMER Roadmap
Visual representation of the Knowledge Hub Composition

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: D2.2 Quantitative mapping research report
result.description: This Deliverable will include a mapping of EU regions and identify those that would benefit the most from the TRANSFORMER SuperLab approach which focuses especially on innovationleverage points at the intersection of sociotechnical regimes in regions

result.title: D1.2 Project Management Plan - version 1
result.description: The Project Management Plan summarises the overall management and internal reporting procedures ensuring close cooperation and integration of different WPs and project activities

result.title: D6.2 Communication and Dissemination Strategy and Plan - version 2
result.description: This Deliverable will consist of the adjusted final strategy outlining the analysis of target audiences and their needs visual guidelines key messages and channels to reach them the Implementation Plan setting out communication activities workflows and establishing guidelines and templates for dissemination materials mapping of partner networks the Monitoring Plan including KPIs and mechanisms for evaluating impact and effectiveness of the proposed activities within WP6 The implementation will be done via the development and creation of visual and textual media content to be shared online on own and partner channels translating the complex technical content of TRANSFORMER TSLs solutions to formats suitable for a wider variety of stakeholders

result.title: D4.2 Super-Lab Roadmap – version 2
result.description: This Deliverable will consist of a second and final version blueprint for a Super-Lab Roadmap. It will be developed by expanding and reworking the first version of this Deliverable including all relevant achievements and results made in the TRANSFORMER project from month 12 to 24. Thus, this Deliverable is based on an iterative learning process, where lessons learned from the participating TSLs (WP3) and beyond via a “User Forum” (WP6) will be integrated.

result.title: D6.1 Communication and Dissemination Strategy and Plan - version 1
result.description: This Deliverable will consist of the strategy outlining the analysis of target audiences and their needs visual guidelines key messages and channels to reach them the Implementation Plan setting out communication activities workflows and establishing guidelines and templates for dissemination materials mapping of partner networks the Monitoring Plan including KPIs and mechanisms for evaluating impact and effectiveness of the proposed activities within WP6 The implementation will be done via the development and creation of visual and textual media content to be shared online on own and partner channels translating the complex technical content of TRANSFORMER TSLs solutions to formats suitable for a wider variety of stakeholders

result.title: D1.1 Data Management Plan
result.description: The Data Management Plan to the granting authority in accordance with the Grant Agreement, which summarises how the project will ensure open access to research data and will secure usage of personal data according to EU and national laws.

result.title: D3.3 Transition Super-Lab Action Plan (APs per TSL as Annex)
result.description: This Deliverable will document mission- and scenario(s)-oriented measure planning, incl. defining roles and responsibilities of coalition members, internal and external communication planning, measures for access to and availability of TSL equipment and infrastructure, identifying co-created values/potential impacts for all measures, and for developing business models and financing/funding schemes (based on consultation on green innovation procurement, available financing and funding programmes, etc.) and for the uptake and scalability of the TSL measures. Each TSL will develop an Action Plan, which will be reviewed by both partners (cross-TSL, knowledge partners) and external stakeholders, e.g. ZENIT, EIB, World Bank.

result.title: D1.3 Project Management Plan – version 2
result.description: Intermediary update of previous Project Management Plan according to necessities and contingencies that came up during the course of the project

result.title: D4.3 Toolkits (incl. matchmaking system) for Transition Super-Lab Roadmap Implementation
result.description: This Deliverable will consist of a blueprint for a Super-Lab Roadmap based on an iterative learning process. Lessons learned from the participating TSLs (WP3) and beyond via a “User Forum” (WP6) will be integrated into its development. A first version will be developed in month 12, a second version in month 24.

result.title: D1.4 Project Management Plan – version 3
result.description: Final update of previous Project Management Plan according to necessities and contingencies that came up during the course of the project.

result.title: D6.4 TRANSFORMER capacity building activity report
result.description: This Deliverable will consist of the Capacity Building Plan and a modular package of capacity building tools and methodologies, based on a comprehensive capacity and training needs assessment (TNA) of transition and innovation potential in the four partner regions (Target Group A). With a blend of on-site, online and hybrid trainings, workshops, webinars, study tours, e-learning courses, and peer-to-peer exchanges, Target Group A will be trained and equipped to engage as experts in the knowledge transfer exercise with a wider group of stakeholders, with an explicit focus on integrating marginalised communities, (Target Group B) that can make TSL thrive and push innovation at regional level forward, and with other (follower) regions across Europe (Target Group C).

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
